metadata.title: CVE-2020-9281 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor for CKEditor 4.0 before 4.14 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script through a crafted "protected" comment (with the cke_protected syntax).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-9281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.16.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.0+dfsg-2').
